page.title: 05MAINS SEWAGE DEBATE,CAUNTON
page.content: In 1974 Severn and Trent water authority put main line sewerage into villages close by and promised to bring it to Caunton, but when the time came Severn and Trent decided not to bring it any further. The Parish Council were quite annoyed and started to write letters. Severn and Trent turned down these requests. 1982 main line sewerage was offered again. The local population were now unsure as to whether they wanted main line sewerage or not. The argument against was there would be new houses and it would spoil the countryside. Eventually a meeting was held and nine out of ten people in Caunton voted against main line sewage.
